availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Green (Danville, Kentucky, circuit court judge and politician)

body.p: Danville, Kentucky, soldier, politician, and judge. Virginia native. Married to Sarah A. Fry Green. Married to Mary Keith Marshall Paxton Green. Veteran of the War of 1812. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Lincoln County in 1818. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Lincoln County from 1826 to 1832. Judge of Lincoln County Circuit Court from 1834 to 1838.

ab.bibl:
Find A Grave, "Judge John Green (1786-1838)," Memorial #40788687, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40788687 (accessed May 6, 2020).
Stella Pickett Hardy, Colonial Families of the Southern States of America, (New York: Tobias A. Wright, Printer and Publisher, 1911), p. 242.
